meanings.definition: A small hole in a firearm through which the charge is ignited.
meanings.sent1: The touchhole in the cannon allowed for the ignition of the gunpowder.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to block the touchhole when loading the musket.
meanings.sent3: The soldier accidentally sneezed into the touchhole, causing a comical misfire.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a touchhole, igniting a spark of inspiration in those around him.
meanings.sent5: The touchhole glowed red hot as the cannon fired, lighting up the battlefield.

meanings.definition: A small hole in a container for pouring or filling.
meanings.sent1: The touchhole in the watering can made it easy to pour water onto the plants.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to seal the touchhole tightly to prevent any leaks.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally spilled the paint through the touchhole, creating a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: The touchhole of the bottle seemed like a gateway to a refreshing drink.
meanings.sent5: The touchhole on the oil can was so small that it took patience to fill the lamp.
